answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
A similar question was previously asked on the knowledge network by another member. You can see the question and answers below:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20169/Animal_Services__Outsourcing_Operations
I also found a news article about Alameda, CA where they
are considering shifting management of their local shelter to a non-profit. You may want to contact them for more information.
http://alameda.patch.com/articles/alamedas-animal-shelter-could-soon-be-run-by-nonprofit
I also included a case study from Washoe County, NV  highlighting their animal service centers which are based on community collaboration.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301067/Animal_Services__Creating_a_WinWin
ICMA has other resources that might be helpful to you. The book Animal Control Management: A Guide for Local Governments which has a chapter highlighting working with outside organizations.
http://bookstore.icma.org/freedocs/Animal%20Control%20Excerpt.pdf
For more general information about creating partnerships with organizations you can use the ICMA Report, Interlocal Service-Sharing Agreements.
http://bookstore.icma.org/Interlocal_Service-Sharing_Agr_P1637C7.cfm?UserID=6263466&jsessionid=4e3046dc275242607441
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
